alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:51PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Niobrara, northwestern Goshen and northern Platte Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 550 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Keeline to 6 miles southeast of Two Moon Campground to 10 miles southeast of Harris Park. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Guernsey, Glendo, Lakeview North, Sibley Peak, Guernsey Campground, Rawhide Buttes, Glendo Reservoir, Two Moon Campground and Hartville. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 81 and 110. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range
